metadata.title: CVE-2020-15655 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A redirected HTTP request which is observed or modified through a webextension could bypass existing CORS checks, leading to potentialdisclosure of cross-origin information. This vulnerability affects FirefoxESR < 78.1, Firefox < 79, and Thunderbird < 78.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
